subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] [Fwd: test e-mail]
msgSnippet: I actually mistook your test for a mail sent to the Shavian group, hence my comment about nobody having it installed! Obviously people who read the QS mails
messageBody:
I actually mistook your test for a mail sent to the Shavian group, hence my comment about nobody having it installed! Obviously people who read the QS mails should be able to see the tests displayed in Kingsley.

 

I use Outlook 2003 so can read all HTML mails written in any font I have installed. I can’t understand how anyone can still be using a mail client incapable of displaying HTML after all these years!

 

I think Yahoo might’ve recently improved how they handle such mails. The web interface certainly looks different from how it always used to.

 

Hugh B

 

From: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com [mailto:Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Paige Gabhart
Sent: 04 March 2006 16:19
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] [Fwd: test e-mail]

 

Hugh:

Am I nuts, or is this the first time we've been able to send an e-mail through in a QS font without it being messed up in the process?  I was responding to your question regarding musicians last night from the Shaw Alphabet site and discovered that the response went through in QS. (I didn't expect it to.  Previously, I had always had to cut and paste it into a word processor.) I then converted it to Shavian and that went through fine as well.  So this morning, I thought I would try sending a message in Quikscript through Read_Alphabet, and I find that works.

So what has changed that is letting this work?  I am using mozilla thunderbird as my mail client.

Paige

Hugh Birkenhead wrote:

It survives intact on my screen... but I don’t think anyone else here will have it installed?

 

Hugh B
